result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley M Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

Costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid. Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same repayment provisions apply as noted above for Count No. 1.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley M Larson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter from defendant to Court-requesting the court reconsider denial.
From DA to Court-will defer to court
From Defendant to Court requesting release.

15CM183 & 15CM401 Cases called @ 2:44 p.m.  Defendant Bradley M. Larsen in court with attorney Scott M Engstrom.  Defendant Bradley M. Larsen in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 15CM401 - Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Repeater enhancer dismissed outright. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Engstrom. No statement by the defendant. Court orders: 90 days WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - consecutive to any sentence that may exist in the event of a revocation, 18 mos probation - Conditions: DAAP and follow through, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, NC w/ T. Vest-McKellip unless specifically authorized by supervising agent, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.

15CM183 - Parties have received the revocation packet. No corrections or clarifications to be made. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. The parties stipulate to 61 days CFTS.  Court orders: 8 mos WCJ on both counts concurrent - Huber, GT, 61 days CFTS, costs reimposed to the extent not previously paid. Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 12-07-2015 02:30 pm

Case Called 3:16 PM: Defendant Bradley M Larson in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Terms of resolution recited by ADA.  SPD and Def confirm resolution.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Victim present and declines to make any statement today.  Plea Ct 1 as charged:  NC  Plea Ct 2 as charged:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  No claim for restitution confirmed by State and Victim.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution in light of the circumstances, Def currently on supervision - ATR to commence 6/18/15.  As to both Counts - S/W - 18 mos probation - concurrent with one another - and concurrent to any sentence currently being served.  Conditions:  Complete DAAP or its equivalent, AODA and any follow thru as deemed appropriate, the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  DNA Sample to be provided with Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge on each count.  2 days TS credit.  It is assumed that sample had previously been provided.  Def confirms that damaged window has already been fixed.  Appeal Rights Given.
from DA w/ attached letter from DOC requesting no scheduling between June 22, 2015 and September 21, 2015 - defendant will be participating in in-patient treatment at MSDF

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case Called @ 4:20 PM: Defendant Bradley M Larson in court, appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def confirms that PO hold is currently in place.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wishes to obtain counsel thru SPD.  Defendant referred to SPD for eligibility.  ADA argues as to bond - very little information known as to this Def.  Def states he is currently on extended supervision from Winnebago Co Cases with release in 2019.   Asks for small cash bond.  The Court:  Finds probable cause is supported in the 2 alleged charges.  Authorizes $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
